Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.util

Class MathUtils

java.lang.Object
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.util.MathUtils
public final class MathUtils extends Object
A set of mathematical constants, functions and algorithms.

  • Method Details

    • min

      @Contract(pure=true, value="!null, !null -> !null; !null, null -> param1; null, !null -> param2; null, null -> null") public static <T extends Number & Comparable<T>> T min(T a, T b)
      Returns the smaller of two numeric values. Both operands must be of the same type. If the arguments have the same value, the result is that same value. If either value is NaN, then the result is also NaN. If exactly one of the arguments is null, the result is the other argument, whereas if both values are null, then the result is also null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the numbers type
      Parameters:
      a - first operand
      b - second operand
      Returns:
      the smaller of a and b

    • max

      @Contract(pure=true, value="!null, !null -> !null; !null, null -> param1; null, !null -> param2; null, null -> null") public static <T extends Number & Comparable<T>> T max(T a, T b)
      Returns the bigger of two numeric values. Both operands must be of the same type. If the arguments have the same value, the result is that same value. If either value is NaN, then the result is also NaN. If exactly one of the arguments is null, the result is the other argument, whereas if both values are null, then the result is also null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the numbers type
      Parameters:
      a - first operand
      b - second operand
      Returns:
      the bigger of a and b

    • clamp

      @Contract(pure=true, value="!null, !null, !null -> !null; !null, !null, null -> !null; !null, null, !null -> !null; !null, null, null -> param1; null, !null, !null -> !null; null, !null, null -> param2; null, null, !null -> param3; null, null, null -> null;") public static <T extends Number & Comparable<T>> T clamp(T value, T lowerBound, T upperBound)
      Constraints the specified value to the specified bounds. If value is less than lowerBound, then lowerBound is returned. If value is greater than upperBound, then upperBound is returned. All arguments must be of the same type. If any argument is NaN, then the result is also NaN. If either bound is null, it is ignored. If value is null, lowerBound is returned. If value and lowerBound is null, upperBound is returned. If all three parameters are null, then the result is also null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the numbers type
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be constrained
      lowerBound - the lower bound (inclusive)
      upperBound - the upper bound (inclusive)
      Returns:
      the specified value, unless it is outside the specified bounds, in which case the closer bound is returned
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when lowerBound is greater than upperBound

    • pow

      @Contract(pure=true) public static long pow(long x, int n)
      Performs a power operation by iterative multiplication. This method, unlike Math.pow(double, double), is guaranteed to yield a mathematically correct result. However, if result is too big or too small to be stored in a long variable, Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE is returned.
      Parameters:
      x - the base
      n - the exponent, must be positive or zero
      Returns:
      x^n; the nth power of x

    • degToRad

      @Contract(pure=true) public static float degToRad(float angle)
      Converts an angle value in degrees to a value in radians. Unlike Math.toRadians(double), this method operates on float values.
      Parameters:
      angle - an angle value in degrees
      Returns:
      the specified angle in radians

    • radToDeg

      @Contract(pure=true) public static float radToDeg(float angle)
      Converts an angle value in radians to a value in degrees. Unlike Math.toDegrees(double), this method operates on float values.
      Parameters:
      angle - an angle value in radians
      Returns:
      the specified angle in degrees

      @Contract(pure=true) public static boolean probability(float probability)
      Returns true with given probability using the Random pseudorandom-number generator.
      Parameters:
      probability - the probability that returned value is true
      Returns:
      true with the probability of the parameter value

    • distance

      @Contract(pure=true) public static float distance(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f origin, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f target)
      Computes the distance between the specified points using Pythagorean theorem.
      Parameters:
      origin - the target point
      target - the origin point
      Returns:
      the distance between the two points

    • taxicabDistance

      @Contract(pure=true) public static int taxicabDistance(Vector2i a, Vector2i b)
      Returns the taxicab (Manhattan geometry) distance between two points, which is the result of the following expression: Math.abs(a.x - b.x) + Math.abs(a.x - b.y)
      Parameters:
      a - first point
      b - second point
      Returns:
      the taxicab distance between the points

    • isInsideCircle

      public static boolean isInsideCircle(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f point, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f circlePosition, float circleRadius)
      Detects whether or not the specified point is contained within a circle of the specified middle point and radius.
      Parameters:
      point - a point
      circlePosition - the middle point of the circle
      circleRadius - the radius of the circle
      Returns:
      whether the specified point is contained within the specified circle

    • shortNotation

      @Contract(pure=true) public static String shortNotation(long number)
      Returns the specified number formatted in "kmbtqp" notation with one decimal place, rounded down (if the number is positive) or up (if the number is negative). Examples:
      • shortNotation(72457) // "72.4k"
      • shortNotation(2489697245700) // "2.4q"
      • shortNotation(198345134672) // "198.3b"
      • shortNotation(129) // "129"
      • shortNotation(724000619032) // "724b"
      • shortNotation(82745824) // "-82.7m"
      • shortNotation(1892722390) // "-1.8t"
      Parameters:
      number - a number
      Returns:
      the specified number formatted in "kmbtqp" notation with one decimal place

    • direction

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public static @NotNull Vector2f direction(float angle)
      Computes the direction unit vector (normalzed) for going in the direction of the specified angle (in degrees; 0 means upward and the direction of increasing the angle is clockwise).
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle relative to the Y axis
      Returns:
      normalzed direction for going in the direction of the specified angle

    • direction

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _ -> new") public static @NotNull Vector2f direction(@NotNull @NotNull Vector2f origin, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f target)
      Computes the direction unit vector (normalzed) from the origin to the target point, or Vector2f.ZERO if the specified points have the same coordinates
      Parameters:
      origin - the target point
      target - the origin point
      Returns:
      normalzed direction vector from the origin to the target

    • collisionDirection

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _, _ -> new") public static @NotNull Vector2f collisionDirection(@NotNull @NotNull CircleShape circle, @NotNull @NotNull Vector2f circleDirection, @NotNull @NotNull RectangleShape rectangle)
      Computes the direction vector of a CircleShape moving in the specified direction after it collides with a RectangleShape. If circle and rectangle are not colliding, circleDirection is returned.
      Parameters:
      circle - a circle shape
      circleDirection - the circle shape's moving direction
      rectangle - a rectangle shape
      Returns:
      the new circle's direction vector moving in the direction of circleDirection if it collides with rectangle, or the current circle's direction vector otherwise
